pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:5.1: 60. The training rule on holding a weapon
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people holding a weapon. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:7.1: “‘I will not give teachings to anyone holding a weapon who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:9.1: One should not give teachings to anyone holding a weapon who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:9.2: If a monk out of disrespect gives teachings to someone holding a weapon who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:10.2): if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:10.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:11.1: The tenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:11.2: The sixth chapter on slurping is finished.
